verses.roman:
saṁsāra-sukha tomāra ha-uka vināśa
śāpa śuni' prabhura citte ha-ila ullāsa

synonyms: saṁsāra-sukha—material happiness; tomāra—Your; ha-uka—may it become; vināśa—all vanquished; śāpa śuni'-hearing this curse; prabhura—of the Lord; citte—within His mind; ha-ila—there was; ullāsa—jubilation.
translation: The brāhmaṇa cursed the Lord, "You shall be bereft of all material happiness!" When the Lord heard this, He felt great jubilation within Himself.
